intro: Taraxacum stevenii, commonly known as Steven's dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of serrated, hairy leaves. The plant produces a hollow, leafless stem that supports a single flower head composed of numerous yellow ray florets. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Steven's dandelion is often found in alpine meadows and is noted for its resilience to cold and harsh climatic conditions.
